com.toolrental.validators

Class ToolChargeValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.toolrental.validators.BaseValidator
      • com.toolrental.validators.ToolChargeValidator

  • public class ToolChargeValidator
extends BaseValidator

    Validates the properties of a ToolCharge instance to ensure all required attributes are properly populated. This class extends BaseValidator and provides a concrete implementation of the validation logic for tool charge data.

    The validation checks include:

    • Presence of the tool type.
    • Presence of the daily charge.
    • Presence of flags for weekday, weekend, and holiday charges.

    If any of the validations fail, the validate method throws an IllegalArgumentException containing detailed error messages.

    Version:
    $Revision: 1.0 $Date: 2024/12/03 12:00:00
    Author:
    Michael Escott

    • Method Detail

      • validate

        public void validate(ToolCharge toolCharge)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Validates a ToolCharge instance to ensure all necessary attributes are defined and meet the required conditions.
        Parameters:
        toolCharge - the ToolCharge object to be validated
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the toolCharge object is null or any of its required fields are missing or invalid. The exception message contains a detailed summary of validation errors.

        The following validations are performed:

        • Checks if the toolCharge object is null.
        • Ensures that the toolType field is not null.
        • Ensures that the dailyCharge field is not null.
        • Validates the hasWeekdayCharge, hasWeekendCharge, and hasHolidayCharge flags.

        Example usage: 

        
 ToolCharge toolCharge = new ToolCharge();
 toolCharge.setToolType("Ladder");
 toolCharge.setDailyCharge(100.0);
 toolCharge.setHasWeekdayCharge(true);
 toolCharge.setHasWeekendCharge(false);
 toolCharge.setHasHolidayCharge(false);

 ToolChargeValidator validator = new ToolChargeValidator();
 try {
     validator.validate(toolCharge);
 } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {
     System.err.println(e.getMessage());
 }
